node.title: F.T.C. Sues to Block the Chip Maker Nvidiaâ€™s Takeover of the Chip Designer Arm
node.description: The proposed deal would give Nvidia control over computing technology and designs that rival firms rely on.
node.content: ["WASHINGTON \u2014 The Federal Trade Commission on Thursday sued to block Nvidia\u2019s $40 billion acquisition of a fellow chip company, Arm, stopping one of the biggest semiconductor industry deals in history.", "The F.T.C. said the deal between Nvidia, which is based in California and makes chips, and Arm, a British company that designs chips, would stifle competition and harm consumers. The proposed deal would give Nvidia control over computing technology and designs that rival firms rely on to develop competing chips.", "\u201cTomorrow\u2019s technologies depend on preserving today\u2019s competitive, cutting-edge chip markets,\u201d said Holly Vedova, the director of the F.T.C.\u2019s competition bureau. \u201cThis proposed deal would distort Arm\u2019s incentives in chip markets and allow the combined firm to unfairly undermine Nvidia\u2019s rivals.\u201d", "The companies announced the merger in September 2020 and said the merger would position the companies as leaders in semiconductors for artificial intelligence.", "This breaking news story will be updated."]
